definition: (music) fingering/(TCM) manipulation of acupuncture needles/(keyboard) typing technique/(dance) hand movements/(painting) finger method
finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: I am all thumbs when I play the guitar.
sentences.chinese: 我弹吉它时指法都很生涩。

sentences.english: There they are in front of you, fingering their wallets.
sentences.chinese: 但他们是在你面前，指法的钱包。

sentences.english: He practices scales, fingering, melody and rhythm.
sentences.chinese: 他练习指法，平衡，音乐和节奏。

sentences.english: Master: Oh, you know this hold?
She has a very good notion of fingering, though her taste is not equal to Anne's.
sentences.chinese: 虽说她的趣味比不上安妮，可是她很懂得指法。
尝试发明你自己的指法。

sentences.english: Personally, I don't think that fingering or sight-reading is any harder on the guitar than on the violin.
sentences.chinese: 个人认为，指法和视奏在吉他上一点也比小提琴难。

sentences.english: Therefore, you should develop your own set of fingerings for sight reading.
sentences.chinese: 所以你必须为了视奏而发展自己的一套指法。

definition: circular finger movement (in playing plucked instrument)/strumming
to notate music/to write a score
to indicate the phonetic value of a word using other words
tuning (stringed instrument)/(fig.) to make up one's mind
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
